ground_truth: Doyle gives her a scathing look and Jeff challenges Doyle. Lisa answers, but very coldly, as Doyle hesitates a moment, letting his eyes wander to the overnight case with Lisa's lingerie, before his eyes go back to Jeff. Jeff replies, pointedly, while Lisa looks down at Jeff, not comprehending. Meanwhile, Doyle is wiping his coat lapels with a handkerchief. Neither Jeff nor Lisa display even the slightest friendliness; their faces are cold and set. Doyle looks at them pleasantly, starts away toward the door, as Lisa, still burning, then speaks icily. Doyle picks up his hat, relaxed, and poises on the step, snapping his fingers. He starts up the steps to the door, puts on his hat, smiles, and says something before quietly closing the door behind him. Jeff turns his chair around and looks out to the neighborhood, with Lisa standing glumly behind him. None of the gaiety is reflected in Lisa and Jeff, despite it being a happy, gay affair at the songwriter's party, now in full swing and fairly crowded. Miss Torso's apartment has the door closed, and all we can see of her are her legs swinging in arcs as she exercises to record music. During this, she has been staring out at Thorwald's apartment, but Lisa is not looking in the same direction as Jeff. She murmurs to Jeff, and now her eyes are looking at the apartment underneath. Jeff turns his eyes in the same direction as hers, witnessing the surprise of seeing her return with a lover hooked, who is much younger than she and more keyed up to the promise of an adventure still fresh to him. A light has gone on in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, and they look on. Her actions are coy and over-feminine, and as she sips her drink looking at him over the rim of the glass, he tosses his off with nervous dispatch. He moves toward her more cautiously this time, leading to an embrace and a long kiss. He begins kissing her cheek, ear, and neck, but suddenly and fiercely she pushes him away, slapping him across the face. He moves back with shock as she loudly and emphatically orders him out. He flushes with anger and embarrassment, his mouth twisting into unpleasant shapes as he slaps degrading words back at her, telling her what she is, and she screams at him to get out. He leaves, slamming the door behind him, as she goes back dumbly to the spilled liquor, making a futile effort to clean it up before collapsing onto the rug, sobbing hard enough to shake her whole body. Meanwhile, Lisa turns away from Jeff's chair to get a cigarette from the table.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Doyle bestows her a caustic gaze and Jeff defies Doyle. Lisa responds, but very frigidly, as Doyle falters a moment, allowing his eyes to drift to the overnight bag with Lisa's undergarments, before his eyes return to Jeff. Jeff retorts, sharply, while Lisa glances down at Jeff, not grasping. Meanwhile, Doyle is cleaning his coat lapels with a hankie. Neither Jeff nor Lisa exhibit even the slightest cordiality; their visages are frigid and fixed. Doyle regards them agreeably, starts away toward the entrance, as Lisa, still seething, then speaks frostily. Doyle lifts his hat, unperturbed, and balances on the step, clicking his fingers. He starts up the steps to the entrance, dons his hat, grins, and utters something before quietly shutting the entrance behind him. Jeff rotates his seat around and gazes out to the vicinity, with Lisa standing sullenly behind him. None of the merriment is mirrored in Lisa and Jeff, despite it being a joyful, cheerful event at the songwriter's gathering, now in full swing and fairly crowded. Miss Torso's dwelling has the entrance closed, and all we can witness of her are her limbs swinging in arcs as she exercises to recorded melody. During this, she has been staring out at Thorwald's dwelling, but Lisa is not gazing in the identical direction as Jeff. She murmurs to Jeff, and now her eyes are peering at the dwelling beneath. Jeff swivels his eyes in the identical direction as hers, witnessing the astonishment of observing her return with a paramour attached, who is much younger than she and more attuned to the promise of an escapade still fresh to him. A light has illuminated in Miss Lonely Hearts' dwelling, and they observe. Her actions are coquettish and overly-feminine, and as she sips her drink peering at him over the rim of the glass, he tosses his off with anxious speed. He advances toward her more warily this instance, culminating in an embrace and a prolonged kiss. He commences kissing her cheek, ear, and neck, but suddenly and fiercely she shoves him away, striking him across the visage. He recoils with shock as she loudly and emphatically commands him out. He flushes with rage and humiliation, his mouth contorting into unpleasant forms as he hurls degrading words back at her, telling her what she is, and she shrieks at him to depart. He exits, slamming the entrance behind him, as she returns dumbly to the spilled beverage, making an ineffective effort to tidy it up before collapsing onto the carpet, sobbing hard enough to convulse her whole physique. Meanwhile, Lisa turns away from Jeff's seat to grab a cigarette from the table.

test_cases.description: Doyle is given a scathing look by her, and Doyle is challenged by Jeff. A very cold answer is given by Lisa, but Doyle hesitates for a moment, letting his eyes wander to the overnight case with Lisa's lingerie before his eyes are brought back to Jeff. A pointed reply is made by Jeff, while Jeff is looked at by Lisa, not comprehending. Meanwhile, Doyle wipes his coat lapels with a handkerchief. Neither the slightest friendliness is displayed by Jeff nor Lisa; their faces are cold and set. Doyle looks at them pleasantly, starts away toward the door, as Lisa, still burning, then speaks icily. Doyle picks up his hat, relaxed, and poises on the step, snapping his fingers. He starts up the steps to the door, puts on his hat, smiles, and something is said by him before the door is quietly closed by him behind him. Jeff turns his chair around and looks out at the neighborhood, with Lisa standing glumly behind him. None of the gaiety is reflected in Lisa and Jeff, despite it being a happy, gay affair at the songwriter's party, now in full swing and fairly crowded. The door of Miss Torso's apartment is closed, and all we can see of her are her legs swinging in arcs as record music is exercised to by her. During this, Thorwald's apartment has been stared at by her, but Lisa is not looking in the same direction as Jeff. Jeff is murmured to by her, and now the apartment underneath is looked at by her eyes. His eyes are turned by Jeff in the same direction as hers, witnessing the surprise of seeing her return with a lover hooked, who is much younger than she and more keyed up to the promise of an adventure still fresh to him. A light goes on in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, and they look on. Her actions are coy and over-feminine, and as she sips her drink looking at him over the rim of the glass, his is tossed off with nervous dispatch by him. This time, he cautiously moves toward her, leading to an embrace and a long kiss. He begins kissing her cheek, ear, and neck, but suddenly and fiercely he is pushed away by her, and his face is slapped by her. Shocked, he moves back as a loud, emphatic order is given by her for him to get out. Anger and embarrassment flush him, his mouth twisting into unpleasant shapes as degrading words are slapped back at her by him, telling her what she is, and she screams at him to get out. The door is slammed behind him as he leaves, as she goes back dumbly to the spilled liquor, a futile effort to clean it up is made by her before she collapses onto the rug, sobbing hard enough to shake her whole body. Meanwhile, Lisa turns away from Jeff's chair to get a cigarette from the table.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Doyle gives her a scathing look, and Jeff challenges him. Lisa responds coldly as Doyle hesitates, glancing at Lisa's lingerie case before looking back at Jeff. Jeff replies pointedly, while Lisa looks at Jeff, confused. Doyle wipes his coat lapels with a handkerchief. Jeff and Lisa remain unfriendly, their faces cold. Doyle smiles pleasantly, picks up his hat, and snaps his fingers before leaving. Jeff turns his chair to look out at the neighborhood, with Lisa standing glumly behind him. Despite the lively party at the songwriter's, Jeff and Lisa show no gaiety. Miss Torso's apartment door is closed, and only her legs are visible as she exercises to music. She stares at Thorwald's apartment, but Lisa looks elsewhere. She murmurs to Jeff, directing his gaze to the apartment below, where they see a woman return with a younger lover. In Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, a light is on. She acts coyly, sipping her drink while he nervously downs his. He approaches her cautiously, leading to an embrace and a long kiss. He kisses her cheek, ear, and neck, but she suddenly pushes him away, slapping him. Shocked, he angrily insults her as she screams for him to leave. He exits, slamming the door, while she collapses onto the rug, sobbing. Meanwhile, Lisa turns away from Jeff to get a cigarette from the table.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Doyle gives Lisa a scathing look, and Jeff challenges him. Lisa responds coldly as Doyle hesitates, glancing at her lingerie case before looking back at Jeff. Jeff replies pointedly, while Lisa looks at him, confused. Doyle wipes his coat lapels, and neither Jeff nor Lisa show friendliness. Doyle smiles, picks up his hat, and leaves, snapping his fingers. Jeff turns to look out at the neighborhood, with Lisa standing glumly behind him. Despite the lively party at the songwriter's, Lisa and Jeff remain unaffected. Miss Torso's apartment door is closed, and only her legs are visible as she exercises. Lisa murmurs to Jeff, directing his gaze to the apartment below, where they see Miss Lonely Hearts with a younger lover. She coyly sips her drink, but after a long kiss, she pushes him away and orders him out. He leaves angrily, slamming the door, while she collapses, sobbing. Meanwhile, Lisa turns away to get a cigarette.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Doyle directs a scathing look at her, and Jeff, not one to back down, challenges Doyle with a firm stance. Lisa responds, but her tone is icy and distant, as Doyle hesitates for a brief moment, allowing his gaze to drift over to the overnight case containing Lisa's delicate lingerie, before his eyes return to focus on Jeff. Jeff replies in a pointed manner, while Lisa gazes down at Jeff, unable to comprehend the situation fully. Meanwhile, Doyle is meticulously wiping his coat lapels with a handkerchief, maintaining his composure. Neither Jeff nor Lisa exhibit even the slightest hint of friendliness; their expressions remain cold and unyielding. Doyle, however, looks at them with a pleasant demeanor, and begins to make his way toward the door. Lisa, still simmering with anger, speaks with an icy tone. Doyle, appearing relaxed, picks up his hat and pauses on the step, snapping his fingers in a casual manner. He ascends the steps to the door, places his hat on his head, smiles, and says something before quietly closing the door behind him. Jeff then turns his chair around to look out at the neighborhood, with Lisa standing glumly behind him. Despite the fact that the songwriter's party is a lively and joyous affair, now in full swing and fairly crowded, none of the gaiety is reflected in Lisa and Jeff. Miss Torso's apartment has its door closed, and all that is visible of her are her legs swinging in arcs as she exercises to the rhythm of record music. During this time, she has been staring out at Thorwald's apartment, but Lisa's gaze is not aligned with Jeff's. She murmurs something to Jeff, and now her eyes are directed at the apartment below. Jeff shifts his gaze in the same direction as hers, witnessing the surprise of seeing her return with a lover in tow, who is significantly younger than she is and more excited by the promise of an adventure that is still fresh to him. A light has illuminated Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, and they watch intently. Her actions are coy and overly feminine, and as she sips her drink, she looks at him over the rim of the glass, while he nervously tosses his drink back with haste. He approaches her more cautiously this time, leading to an embrace and a lingering kiss. He begins to kiss her cheek, ear, and neck, but suddenly and with fierce determination, she pushes him away, slapping him across the face. He recoils in shock as she loudly and emphatically orders him to leave. He flushes with a mix of anger and embarrassment, his mouth contorting into unpleasant shapes as he hurls degrading words back at her, telling her what he thinks she is, and she screams at him to get out. He exits, slamming the door behind him, as she returns dumbly to the spilled liquor, making a futile effort to clean it up before collapsing onto the rug, sobbing with such intensity that it shakes her entire body. Meanwhile, Lisa turns away from Jeff's chair to retrieve a cigarette from the table.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Doyle directs a harsh and scathing look directly at her, and Jeff, who is certainly not the type to back down easily from any confrontation, stands his ground and challenges Doyle with a firm and unwavering stance. Lisa responds to the tension in the room, but her tone carries an icy chill and a sense of distance, as Doyle momentarily hesitates, allowing his gaze to drift away momentarily. His eyes wander over to the overnight case containing Lisa's delicate and refined lingerie, a sight that holds his attention briefly before he brings his focus back to Jeff. Jeff, unflinching, replies in a pointed and deliberate manner, while Lisa gazes down at Jeff, her mind unable to fully comprehend or process the complex situation at hand. Meanwhile, Doyle is meticulously wiping his coat lapels with a handkerchief, maintaining an air of composure and calm. Neither Jeff nor Lisa exhibits even the slightest hint of friendliness or warmth; their expressions remain cold, hard, and unyielding. Doyle, however, maintains a pleasant and agreeable demeanor as he begins to make his way toward the door. Lisa, still simmering with a deep-rooted anger, speaks to Doyle using an icy tone that conveys her feelings clearly. Doyle, appearing relaxed and untroubled, picks up his hat and pauses momentarily on the step, casually snapping his fingers. He gracefully ascends the steps to the door, placing his hat on his head with a composed smile, and says something before quietly closing the door behind him with a gentle click. Jeff then turns his chair around to look out at the neighborhood, with Lisa standing glumly and dejectedly behind him. Despite the fact that the songwriter's party is a lively, cheerful affair, now in full swing and fairly crowded with guests, none of the gaiety or joy is reflected in Lisa and Jeff's demeanors. Miss Torso's apartment remains closed, and all that is visible of her are her legs swinging in graceful arcs as she exercises rhythmically to the music from a record. In the midst of this, she has been staring out at Thorwald's apartment, but Lisa's gaze is not aligned with Jeff's. She murmurs something softly to Jeff, and now her eyes are directed at the apartment below. Jeff shifts his gaze to match hers, witnessing the surprise of seeing her return with a lover in tow, who is significantly younger and more invigorated by the promise of a fresh adventure. A light illuminates Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, and they watch with intense interest. Her actions are coy and overly feminine, and as she sips her drink, she gazes at him over the rim of her glass, while he nervously tosses back his drink with haste. He approaches her more cautiously this time, leading to an embrace and a lingering, tender kiss. He starts to kiss her cheek, ear, and neck, but suddenly, with fierce determination, she pushes him away, slapping him across the face. He recoils in shock as she loudly and emphatically orders him to leave. Flushed with a mix of anger and embarrassment, his mouth contorts into unpleasant shapes as he hurls degrading words back at her, expressing his contempt, and she screams at him to get out. He exits, slamming the door forcefully behind him, as she returns dumbly to the spilled liquor, making a futile effort to clean it up before collapsing onto the rug, sobbing with such intensity that it visibly shakes her entire body. Meanwhile, Lisa turns away from Jeff's chair to retrieve a cigarette from the table nearby.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Doyle fixes her with a scathing look, his eyes narrowing as he directs his displeasure toward her, while Jeff, feeling the tension, steps in to challenge Doyle, his voice firm and unyielding. Lisa, caught in the middle, responds to the situation with a cold, detached tone, her words sharp and devoid of warmth. Doyle hesitates for a brief moment, his gaze drifting to the overnight case where Lisa's lingerie is visible, a fleeting distraction before he refocuses on Jeff. Jeff, undeterred, replies with pointed words, his tone carrying a clear message, as Lisa stands above him, her expression one of confusion, unable to fully grasp the exchange. During this tense interaction, Doyle busies himself by wiping his coat lapels with a handkerchief, a small gesture of maintaining composure. Both Jeff and Lisa maintain their cold, set expressions, showing no signs of friendliness or warmth. Doyle, choosing to disengage, offers them a pleasant look before turning away and heading toward the door. Lisa, still simmering with anger, speaks again, her voice icy and cutting. Doyle, unfazed, picks up his hat with a relaxed demeanor, pausing on the step to snap his fingers in a casual gesture. He ascends the steps to the door, placing his hat on his head with a practiced motion, and smiles as he says something, his words lost as he quietly closes the door behind him. Jeff, now alone with Lisa, turns his chair around to face the window, his eyes scanning the neighborhood outside, while Lisa stands behind him, her mood glum and heavy. Despite the lively, cheerful atmosphere of the songwriter's party, which is now in full swing and bustling with guests, neither Jeff nor Lisa reflects any of the gaiety in their demeanor. In Miss Torso's apartment, the door is closed, and only her legs are visible as they swing in arcs, her body moving rhythmically to the music playing from a record. Throughout this, she has been casting glances toward Thorwald's apartment, but Lisa's attention is elsewhere, not aligned with Jeff's gaze. She murmurs something to Jeff, her voice low, as her eyes shift to the apartment below. Jeff follows her line of sight, his eyes widening in surprise as he witnesses the unexpected scene of a woman returning with a much younger lover, his energy and excitement palpable, hinting at the promise of a new adventure. Meanwhile, a light flickers on in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, drawing their attention. Her actions are exaggeratedly coy and feminine as she sips her drink, casting a flirtatious look over the rim of her glass, while her companion nervously downs his drink in one swift motion. He approaches her with more caution this time, leading to an embrace and a lingering kiss. He begins to kiss her cheek, ear, and neck, but suddenly, with fierce determination, she pushes him away, her hand striking his face in a sharp slap. He recoils in shock, his face a mix of anger and embarrassment, as he retaliates with degrading words, his mouth twisting into unpleasant shapes as he hurls insults at her, telling her what he thinks she is. She screams at him to leave, her voice echoing with desperation. He storms out, slamming the door behind him, leaving her alone to face the aftermath. She returns to the spilled liquor, her attempts to clean it up futile, as she collapses onto the rug, her body shaking with sobs that wrack her frame. Meanwhile, Lisa, seeking a momentary distraction, turns away from Jeff's chair and reaches for a cigarette from the table, her movements deliberate and measured.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Doyle gives Lisa a scathing look, prompting Jeff to challenge him. Lisa responds coldly, while Doyle momentarily hesitates, glancing at her overnight case before refocusing on Jeff. As Jeff replies pointedly, Lisa looks at him, confused, while Doyle wipes his coat lapels with a handkerchief. Both Jeff and Lisa remain unfriendly, their expressions cold and set. Doyle, maintaining a pleasant demeanor, heads toward the door. Lisa, still upset, speaks icily as Doyle picks up his hat, relaxes, and snaps his fingers before putting on his hat, smiling, and saying something as he exits quietly. Jeff turns his chair to look out at the neighborhood, with Lisa standing glumly behind him. Despite the lively party at the songwriter's apartment, neither Jeff nor Lisa reflects the gaiety. Miss Torso's apartment door is closed, and only her legs are visible as she exercises to music. Lisa murmurs to Jeff, directing his attention to the apartment below, where they witness Miss Lonely Hearts' surprise return with a younger lover. As a light turns on in her apartment, they observe her coy and overly feminine actions. She sips her drink while he nervously downs his, cautiously approaching her for an embrace and a long kiss. However, she suddenly pushes him away, slapping him and ordering him out. He reacts with anger and embarrassment, hurling degrading words at her before leaving, slamming the door. She returns to the spilled liquor, futilely trying to clean it up before collapsing onto the rug, sobbing. Meanwhile, Lisa turns away from Jeff to get a cigarette from the table.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Doyle gives her a scathing look, reminiscent of a disapproving schoolmaster, and Jeff challenges Doyle, an old college buddy with whom he's had a longstanding competitive relationship. Lisa answers, but very coldly, as Doyle hesitates a moment, letting his eyes wander to the overnight case with Lisa's lingerie, a set from a high-end boutique that Jeff had bought as a surprise gift for their anniversary, before his eyes go back to Jeff. Jeff replies pointedly, his tone reflecting the tension from their earlier debate about Jeff's job as a photojournalist, while Lisa looks down at Jeff, not comprehending the weight of the unspoken words. Meanwhile, Doyle, who is known for his meticulous nature, is wiping his coat lapels with a handkerchief he always carries. Neither Jeff nor Lisa display even the slightest friendliness; their faces are cold and set, a stark contrast to how they usually behave at their favorite Sunday brunch spot. Doyle looks at them pleasantly, maintaining the composure of a detective used to managing tense situations, starts away toward the door, as Lisa, still burning with unresolved feelings from their recent argument, then speaks icily. Doyle picks up his hat, a classic fedora that his grandfather passed down to him, relaxed, and poises on the step, snapping his fingers, a habit he developed during his days as a jazz enthusiast. He starts up the steps to the door, puts on his hat, smiles, and says something reassuring before quietly closing the door behind him. Jeff turns his chair around and looks out to the neighborhood, an eclectic mix of urban life and architecture dating back to the 1920s, with Lisa standing glumly behind him. None of the gaiety is reflected in Lisa and Jeff, despite it being a happy, gay affair at the songwriter's party, known for being a significant networking event for up-and-coming musicians, now in full swing and fairly crowded. Miss Torso's apartment has the door closed, and all we can see of her are her legs swinging in arcs as she exercises to record music from a popular fitness album. During this, she has been staring out at Thorwald's apartment, the new tenant who recently moved in under mysterious circumstances, but Lisa is not looking in the same direction as Jeff. She murmurs to Jeff, and now her eyes are looking at the apartment underneath, the one rumored to have a hidden basement. Jeff turns his eyes in the same direction as hers, witnessing the surprise of seeing her return with a lover hooked, who is much younger than she and more keyed up to the promise of an adventure still fresh to him. A light has gone on in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, the solitary woman known for hosting imaginary dinner parties, and they look on. Her actions are coy and over-feminine, a reflection of her longing for genuine affection, and as she sips her drink looking at him over the rim of the glass, he tosses his off with nervous dispatch, unaware of the emotional depth he's about to encounter. He moves toward her more cautiously this time, leading to an embrace and a long kiss. He begins kissing her cheek, ear, and neck, but suddenly and fiercely she pushes him away, slapping him across the face, reacting to an internal struggle with her self-worth. He moves back with shock as she loudly and emphatically orders him out. He flushes with anger and embarrassment, his mouth twisting into unpleasant shapes as he slaps degrading words back at her, telling her what she is, and she screams at him to get out. He leaves, slamming the door behind him, as she goes back dumbly to the spilled liquor, making a futile effort to clean it up before collapsing onto the rug, sobbing hard enough to shake her whole body, her cries echoing the neighborhood's quiet night. Meanwhile, Lisa turns away from Jeff's chair to get a cigarette from the table, one of a dwindling supply from a trip to Paris they both fondly remember.

Doyle picks up his hat relaxed and poises on the step snapping his fingers. He starts up the steps to the door puts on his hat smiles and says something before quietly closing the door behind him. Jeff turns his chair around and looks out to the neighborhood with Lisa standing glumly behind him. None of the gaiety is reflected in Lisa and Jeff despite it being a happy gay affair at the songwriter's party now in full swing and fairly crowded. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. Miss Torso's apartment has the door closed and all we can see of her are her legs swinging in arcs as she exercises to record music. During this she has been staring out at Thorwald's apartment but Lisa is not looking in the same direction as Jeff. She murmurs to Jeff and now her eyes are looking at the apartment underneath. Jeff turns his eyes in the same direction as hers witnessing the surprise of seeing her return with a lover hooked who is much younger than she and more keyed up to the promise of an adventure still fresh to him. A light has gone on in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment and they look on. Her actions are coy and overfeminine and as she sips her drink looking at him over the rim of the glass he tosses his off with nervous dispatch. He moves toward her more cautiously this time leading to an embrace and a long kiss. He begins kissing her cheek ear and neck but suddenly and fiercely she pushes him away slapping him across the face. He moves back with shock as she loudly and emphatically orders him out. He flushes with anger and embarrassment his mouth twisting into unpleasant shapes as he slaps degrading words back at her telling her what she is and she screams at him to get out. He leaves slamming the door behind him as she goes back dumbly to the spilled liquor making a futile effort to clean it up before collapsing onto the rug sobbing hard enough to shake her whole body. Meanwhile Lisa turns away from Jeff's chair to get a cigarette from the table.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Doyle gives her a bewildered look and Jeff entertains Doyle. Lisa stammers, but very warmly, as Doyle fidgets a moment, letting his eyes drift to the overnight case with Lisa's lingerie, before his eyes go back to Jeff. Jeff comments, absently, while Lisa glances down at Jeff, not understanding. Meanwhile, Doyle is adjusting his coat lapels with a handkerchief. Neither Jeff nor Lisa exude even the slightest excitement; their faces are cheerful and relaxed. Doyle gazes at them somberly, shuffles away toward the door, as Lisa, still pondering, then whispers softly. Doyle lifts his hat, tense, and leans on the step, tapping his fingers. He moves up the steps to the door, places his hat on, frowns, and mutters something before loudly closing the door behind him. Jeff spins his chair around and peers out to the neighborhood, with Lisa standing joyfully behind him. None of the melancholy is mirrored in Lisa and Jeff, despite it being a somber, quiet affair at the songwriter's party, now in low swing and barely populated. Miss Torso's apartment has the door ajar, and all we can see of her are her arms waving in arcs as she dances to record music. During this, she has been glancing out at Thorwald's apartment, but Lisa is not gazing in the same direction as Jeff. She whispers to Jeff, and now her eyes are focused on the apartment above. Jeff shifts his eyes in the same direction as hers, witnessing the surprise of seeing her return with a friend invited, who is much older than she and more worn out by the promise of an adventure still familiar to him. A light has gone off in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, and they turn away. Her actions are timid and understated, and as she sips her drink glancing at him over the rim of the glass, he sets his down with calm precision. He edges toward her more confidently this time, leading to a nod and a brief handshake. He begins patting her back, arm, and shoulder, but suddenly and gently she pulls him closer, hugging him across the chest. He steps back with delight as she quietly and softly invites him to stay. He beams with joy and admiration, his mouth curling into bright shapes as he whispers kind words back at her, telling her what she means to him, and she smiles at him to sit down. He remains, closing the door gently behind him, as she walks back confidently to the unspilled liquor, making a content effort to leave it untouched before draping onto the couch, laughing softly enough to fill the quiet room. Meanwhile, Lisa turns toward Jeff's chair to rearrange a flower on the table.

She beams with joy and pride, her eyes twisting into pleasant forms as she sings encouraging words back at him, asking him who he was, and he whispers to her to come in. She stays, gently closing the window behind her, as he goes back calmly to the served tea, making a triumphant effort to drink it up before rising onto the sofa, singing quietly enough to calm his whole heart. test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Doyle gives Jeff a scathing look and challenges him. Lisa responds coldly, as Doyle's gaze drifts to Lisa's overnight case before returning to Jeff. Jeff replies pointedly while Lisa looks down at him, confused. Doyle wipes his coat lapels and, with a pleasant demeanor, heads towards the door. Lisa, still upset, speaks icily. Doyle picks up his hat, snaps his fingers, and exits with a smile. Jeff turns his chair to look out into the neighborhood, with Lisa standing glumly behind him. Despite a lively party at the songwriter's, Jeff and Lisa remain unaffected. Miss Torso exercises in her closed apartment as Lisa and Jeff observe. Lisa mentions an apartment below, where they witness Miss Lonely Hearts with a much younger lover. The encounter turns sour as she pushes him away and orders him out after an embrace, leading to an argument. He leaves angrily, and she collapses, sobbing. Meanwhile, Lisa turns away from Jeff to get a cigarette.

unpleasant shapes as he slaps degrading words back at her telling her what she is and she screams at him to get out  He leaves slamming the door behind him as she goes back dumbly to the spilled liquor making a futile effort to clean it up before collapsing onto the rug sobbing hard enough to shake her whole body  Meanwhile Lisa turns away from Jeff's chair to get a cigarette from the table Doyle gives her a scathing look and Jeff challenges Doyle  Lisa answers but very coldly as Doyle hesitates a moment letting his eyes wander to the overnight case with Lisa's lingerie before his eyes go back to Jeff  Jeff replies pointedly while Lisa looks down at Jeff not comprehending  Meanwhile Doyle is wiping his coat lapels with a handkerchief  Neither Jeff nor Lisa display even the slightest friendliness  their faces are cold and set  Doyle looks at them pleasantly starts away toward the door as Lisa still burning then speaks icily  Doyle picks up his hat relaxed and poises on the step snapping his fingers  He starts up the steps to the door puts on his hat smiles and says something before quietly closing the door behind him  Jeff turns his chair around and looks out to the neighborhood with Lisa standing glumly behind him  None of the gaiety is reflected in Lisa and Jeff despite it being a happy gay affair at the songwriter's party now in full swing and fairly crowded  Miss Torso's apartment has the door closed and all we can see of her are her legs swinging in arcs as she exercises to record music
